The विमानों or series of miniature shrines on top of the talas of multi - storeyed vimanas are built in the shape of these three shrines the kuta sala ( or पंजर ) and panjara ( or पंजर ) .
They are placed on the corners and on the sides of the floors and are joined by a roof tops with less than the kuta panjara or पंजर arches surmounted by a roof - like roof - like मुंडेर with an arched projection called पार्श्विक - पार्श्विक .
Though the rudiments of the plan of the mandapa are to be seen in the rock - cut caves and in the remains from Nagarjunakonda their compositions were more pronounced in the stone and brick temples of the seventh century .
In the Chalukya - Rashtrakuta series in the Deccan and in those that took after them the mandapa is of two types .
In the first case the परिधीय is divided into the central part ( स्तंभों ) with the peripheral round of small and coarse pillars as in the case of the two broad pillars .
The four central pillars standing at the corners of a central class and the axial column or pilasters in a row at a equal distance build up all the eight sections ( नै ) of the central volume .
The addition of twenty more pillars at the inner row and at the outer quadrant will increase the number of bays to twenty - five and make the mandapa a larger section .
The Pallava - Pandya series of temples and what followed them in material artistic technique and tradition in the succeeding periods in the farther south elaborated the shape from the square to the oblong by emphasizing linear rows of taller pillars with wider diffusion .
All this resulted in such multi - pillared mandapas as the hundred - or thousand - pillared mandapas .
Till about the commencement of the eleventh century the gopuras or storeyed gateways piercing the protective prakara or enclosure wall characteristic of the southern temples were built comparatively smaller than the विमान vimana .
They are essentially oblong on plan transversely linear with the entrance running through at the middle and with a single simple or storeyed superstructure terminated by a sala sikhara with a row of शाला .
The विमान or system of storeys with hara components at each level is much akin to that of the oblong or विमान vimana .
Such pioneering work of making cut - out vimana temples was कार्य by Mamalla ( विमान - 630 - विमान ) and the विमान temple were taken to different degrees of perfection .

The Dharmaraja ratha is three - storeyed square in its ग्रीवा and octagonal in the griva sikhara ; but all the three storeys are intended to be functional .
Thus the vimana is designed to have three superposed garbha - griha against the non - functional but symbolic upper talas in the other rathas and the subsequent structural examples .
In its execution a cellular mode of construction is adopted which consists of three concentric walled squares of increasing height rising one inside the other to the successive heights of the की thus leaving the बीच between them .

Effects on Human Health It has been proved beyond doubt that polluted air is highly detrimental to human health and is a contributory factor in deaths from diseases such as lung cancer .
Air pollution is mostly associated with respiratory diseases ranging from common cold to lung cancer .
Both gaseous and particulate pollutants cause severe damage to the respiratory system leading to emphysema bronchitis and asthma.
प्रदूषित air irritates the eyes and some pollutants like lead tend to accumulate in the body at times to dangerous limits .
The mortality rate is increasing due to lung cancer and the main reason is the existence of polluted air .
Carbon monoxide is an रक्त gas which when inhaled reacts with the haemoglobin in blood to reduce the carrying capacity of oxygen .
The disease is gradually progressive and death occurs due to heart failure or pulmonary tuberculosis .
Other serious dust diseases are the lung disease ( by inhaling coal dust ) फेफडों फेफडों ( शरीर फेफडों ) and फेफडों ( cotton ) .

Pollutants in Oceans Many of us believe that the ocean is too vast to be polluted by man ' s activities .
While it was true some time ago it is not true now .
Many of the pollution problems that affect rivers and lakes also affect the estuaries and coastal zones where the land meets the sea .
The cumulative effects of pollutants affect oceans also .
It has to be pointed out that about 85 per cent of the pollution of the oceans has its origin in the land .
The ocean is the final where polluted rivers along with their water discharge pollutants.

Nuclear explosion tests not only release radioactive materials affecting the test sites but also the remote ones .

Nuclear power plants no doubt help in the production of power .
At present about 17 per cent of the world ' s electricity is generated from nuclear sources .

Nuclear power plants generate three types of wastes : low level high and low level .

High level wastes are liquid wastes which emit excessive radiations and cannot be released into the environment .
By evaporation they are concentrated and stored in double - walled stainless steel tanks with concrete walls .
Here these wastes are converted into solid blocks such as glass .

The conical or roof of the cone has a शंकु or a resulting स्थानीय or a nasal नासिका as locally called नासिका with an % seal on which an entirely carved torana front is formed or at least its front opening .
The local name . ( parrot entrance ) is suggestive of the name .
In front of the entrance is a step on the stone steps with a series of stone slabs producing उभारदार with rich relief sculptures.
The pranala or water - outlet projected from the northern side is of a characteristic , long cylindrical tube - like with a narrow bore made through it simulating a straight elephant emerging out of a vyala mouth .
Externally it is often बीच and divided into ringed nodes at intervals and supported below by a गण or गण .
In the Sri मंडप there is a distinct agra - mandapa often the square sikhara with a slopy roof called the हैं - mandapa .
Externally the quadrangular open court is surrounded by a prakara with a cloister or malika locally called होता or मालिका .
The पार्श्वों has the main gopura or या in front and is often the additional gopura entrance on the back and sides .
Besides the simple prakara of the inner prakara the outer prakara with the भीतर gopura entrance on all the four sides at the प्रागंण temple complexes also has separate रंगशाला and holes like the play the opera ऑपेरा dance and such other arts such as ऑपेरा .
In the अर्धवृत्ताकार temple for अर्धवृत्ताकार है the छत temple is apsidal with a roof of wooden and metal sheet at the north - east corner of the outer opening .
Most of the existing temples at present in Kerala are not very old ; the oldest medieval or later medieval .
The earliest temples have been destroyed because of the perishable material for the construction only the idols of their stone adhishthana and deities पाषाण dvarapalas etc. .
These give us an idea of the continuity from at least the tenth century AD if not earlier .
Such temples with prominent slopy or pent roofs or छतों - roofs on मानसून are to be found extensively distributed over the littoral from Kanyakumari in the south to the south गोवा and Goa on the north .
Their srikoyil or vimana plans include the circular विमान आधिक which is more frequent the elliptical the square the oblong and the apsidal ; they rise often in more than one storeyed .
The top storey over the inner wall is relieved of an elliptical shape or आच्छादित kuta ceiling on the plan of the circular है octagonal and square structure and covered with a row of छत sala or अर्धवृत्ताकार structures on the भीतर walls .
The adhishthana is invariably of granitic stone while the walls and superstructure may be of granite पत्थर or brick and timber .
The roof is made of planks metal sheet or tiles or even thatch in extremely humble structures .
This is suited to the local needs and the deep gradient of the sides and sides of the sikhara brings out not only the rapid precipitation of heavy rain - water but also the walls of the tala and the front walls of the sanctum below .
The central portion of the नाली drain that occurs just before the श्रीकोयिल ' s door and between the outer door of the srikoyil makes a practical part of the ardha - mandapa part in the plan and therefore the main srikoyil is provided with the superstructure of the शुकनासा .
It can be a single flight of steps leading from the front to the nearest gate .
Or बाजुओं often stands in front of the doorway with steps on either side .
Perhaps the largest complex in this series of temples is the शहर or श्री . or the Sri शहर temple पर which is located चित्रोंपम on a low hilly terrain in the central part of शहर city which is also in almost the centre of Kerala .
From its inscriptions the temple is known to have been in existence from the twelfth century though its foundations could have been much older .
It is perhaps the smallest apsidal structure in the Kerala mode of construction.
In the north - west corner of the outer court is the large प्रागंण or opera - hall rectangular in shape and built in typical Kerala style .
Inside the central pavilion all the carved pillars of the multi - pillared hall add to the splendour of the multi - lathe - turned structure .
The whole complex is surrounded by a massive stone prakara with four - storeyed gateways on the four cardinal sides with slopy gable roofs standing as good examples of gopura construction in the Kerala style .
Another large and important temple complex in the south of Kerala is the मंदिर or Anantasayin temple in Trivandrum which was wholly reconstructed in the last two centuries.
The stone - built central shrine is appropriately oblong on plan to enshrine the reclining form of Anantasayin Vishnu .
It is two - storeyed with pent and gable roof patterns for its storeys .
The walls are painted and there are subsidiary shrines for deities like Krishna कृष्ण , , षष्ठ Narasimha षष्ठ Garuda etc .
Its stone sculptures are of a fine quality as also the wood - carving on the ceiling of the पाषाण mandapa .
The Rama temple of भुजाओं in north Kerala is unique in having a rectangular srikoyil with a linear orientation that is with the entrance on one of the shorter sides of the oblong structure .
The front and main sanctum uplift is almost vertical ; while the rear two long arms and the shorter arms of the rear have on the lower side with pent roof and gable roof on the top with a linear row of three छत on the vertical axial row .
In front there is a mukha - mandapa also oblong but with its long axis transverse to that of the srikoyil and provided with stupis over its transversely - oriented axis .
All around there is a ऊंचाई of lesser height .
The lower pent roof is extended as the छत ( शुकनासा ) with a front triangular gable face over the नाली nali or linear antarala - mandapa in front of which is an independent शुकनासा - mandapa .
The का Vishnu temple also belongs to this class .
The roofs are made of metal से and the four - sided pyramidal मुलम्मा have four साने nasikas and single gold - gilt stupis on top.
The Rama temple at काष्ठ has a circular श्रीकोयिल ekatala srikoyil and is noted for its ancient wood - carvings.
The दीवारों - mandapa has profuse wood - carvings while the wall of the shrine has interesting mural paintings .
The srikoyil at Vaikom is similar to those oblong and ekatala with a large स्तूपी conical copper - sheet roofing and a single stupi .
The Siva temple at नटराज has a simple ekatala srikoyil and is noted for its paintings especially of Nataraja .
The pent roof covering the storey below and the apsidal छत roof above with a gable front has a row of three stupis on top.
After a long struggle when the British regained power over Delhi Bahadur Shah went to some secret place .
After his arrest he was brought to the Red Fort by Lt. William किले who could be tried under a military commission constituted under Section 14 of 1857 contrary to all established rules of national and international law .
The European military commission was set up at the instance of Sir John Lawrence the Chief Commissioner of the Punjab and led by Major General C . B . C . मिलिट्री and at the instance of the sentence of the बंदियों to be encountered at Delhi .
The prosecutor for the government was Major F. J. . Deputy Judge Advocate .
On the 27th January 1858 at 11 a. m. the very Diwan of the Red Fort was replaced by a court of justice where Bahadur Shah himself sat as the Emperor of Wales .
Many officers suggested to prosecute the British capital in India but when Delhi was selected for this purpose it was the dream of the British Raj to चूर the glory of lakhs and lakhs of its समर्थकों created by it .
The 82 - year - old Emperor was made to stand for about a quarter of an hour outside the Diwan - e - बंदी where the European spectators continued to shout खिल्ली and shouted at him .
At last the clock struck as half - a - dozen and he was brought inside .
After much exertion and pressure he was not only ' asked ' .
The trial lasted twenty - one days from 27th January 1858 to 9th March 1858 .
About 18 supposed eye - witnesses were examined ; most of them were salaried agents and presented about 200 contemporary documents of material relating to the Revolt of 1857 .
On the 20th day of the proceedings . i . e . 9th March 1858 the court कार्यवाही and prisoner Bahadur Shah Zafar was brought to the court in the care of Ghulam Abbas .
The Judge Advocate read the translation of the prisoner ' s defence before the Commission which was written by him in Urdu .
In his defence Bahadur Shah made no reference to his powers as the sovereign ruler in the war of युद्ध and therefore to the judicial authority of the Commission to try and prosecute the case provided him with only a sentence of reward .
This was the first trial of the British Government which established British supremacy and culminated in the I. N. A. trial which followed the end of British rule in India .
This ignominious trial also brought to an end both the Mughal Empire in India and the East India Company .

Surendra Nath Banerjea remained in Civil Jail for two months but the case created a storm and his name became a household word in the country .

Tilak was tried three 1897 first in 1897 and under Section 124 - A of the Indian Penal Code read an article in Kesari for which he was sentenced to 18 months of rigorous imprisonment .

As regards the charge under Section 153 A the prosecution submitted that the accused frequently alluded in his articles in the Kesari to alien rule " of " white " .

The witnesses for the अभियोक्ता Vishnu Joshi . Jagannath से and Inspector इंस्पेक्टर - were examined by Mr श्री Bar - at - Law .

While cross - examining Joshi Tilak proved that the translations before the court were defective and had perverted the sense of the original articles to give a distorted view .
While cross - examining Inspector तिलक Tilak made him admit that the original search - warrant was not for his residence and that he did not know when the interpolation to search his residence was added .
In his written submission to the court Tilak gave the correct English translation of more than a dozen words as presented in the court .
Oppression tyranny and में are भ्रांतिजनक there and have a distinctly different meaning in writings on political .
I admit that the idioms of one language cannot be the same as those of another .
I would like to point out that the translator was not placed in the witness - box but someone was asked to testify to the correctness of the translation .
There can be of course an official translation and therefore a presumption of correctness of the कठघरे but certain passages which were pointed out as pointed out were the essential translator should have been placed in the witness - box .

It may be said that the defence has not produced its own version .
Tilak 's argument to counter the charge under Section 153 - A was novel and fine .
He said " I can trace a great struggle between the people on the one hand and a mighty bureaucracy on the other; and I ask you to help them not the ones but the whole nation .

Even if this rule is not so it will give me moral support and great satisfaction . "
He ended his speech in these words " I do not ask you for any favour .
I am prepared to stand by the consequences of my action .
You may not agree with my view .
There are two prosecution charges under Section 124 - A and one charge under the charge .
Consider each charge separately and make a decision on each one and I call upon you that if possible I am fair to award justice in accordance with the verdict.
The case is very important to the accused .
The charges are also very serious .
If you think he is guilty you may be लेकिन but if you have any doubt about it and you have any valid reason for this doubt the accused will be able to doubt . "
The gloom hung over the court .
Tilak broke the silence and joked " Let us enjoy pur last tea together . "

Sri Aurobindo ( 1872 - 1872 - 1872 Aurobindo Ghose ) was born in Calcutta on 15 August 1872.
His father पिता Ghose ( 1845 - 1893 ) belonged to the well - known Ghose family of West Bengal .
When Aurobindo was only seven years old अरविंद his father took him and his two elder brother अरविंद . and Manmohan for England .
He had his early education in an English family .
When he joined the St. Paul ' s School in London as a scholar he had already learnt Latin and read on his own Shakespeare and the romantic poets he could .
He also learnt French and Italian Italian and Spanish to read Goethe Dante and दांते in the original language .
He had started writing poetry in Greek Latin ani English when he was only eleven .
As a secretary to the Indian Majlis Cambridge University he made revolutionary speeches hinting at armed rebellion as the way to India ' s freedom .
Although he had passed the Indian Civil Service Examination he did not join it and returned to India in 1893 with an appointment in the Baroda State Service .
He took thirteen years to reach the post of Acting Principal of the State College at Baroda .
He learnt Sanskrit drama and Marathi as well as spoken बांग्ला the epics the Upanishads and Sanskrit literature; wrote poetry drama and essays in English .
He shifted to Calcutta as Principal of the newly - formed National College ( now Jadavpur University ) .
Aurobindo directed the revolutionary workers to utilise the partition for expanding their activities .
He gave instructions to बिपिनचंद्र for his policy determination and organisation and he initiated the famous daily " बिपिनचंद्र " and joined the English daily of Bipin Chandra Pal ' s Bande Mataram .
He published in the Bande Mataram बंदे sequence of articles on' The Doctrine of Passive Resistance ' अहिंसात्मक out a valid method of execution of the nationalist programme of' Swadeshi ' and ' boycott ' .
In August 1907 Aurobindo was arrested for certain articles published in में बंदे ' but the charge failed because it could not be proved that he was the editor of that letter .
In May 1908 along with 38 other revolutionaries he was arrested where he spent one year as " क्रांतिकारियों " before release .
In jail he had the realisation of cosmic consciousness and the vision of Sri Krishna everywhere and in Sri Krishna he had always the assurance of his freedom of India and of his release for the good of the world .
After his acquittal in May 1909 Aurobindo resumed his objectives with two newly - रिहाई कर्मयोगी the कर्मयोगी कर्मयोगी ( the अंग्रेजी of the ' धर्म ' and ' Religion ' in Bangla ) he published an article in the real motive of Indian nationalism .
One evening in February 1910 he received information that his office would be searched the next day and he would be arrested .
Following his inner voice he left for Chandernagore and then for Pondicherry where he completely withdrew from all political activities and devoted himself entirely to literature and philosophy .
In his mission he was ably assisted by an enlightened French फ्रांसिसी Paul Richard and his wife ( who later became famous as the Mother India ) at Pondicherry on the eve of the First World War .
In 1926 Aurobindo retired into seclusion which was till his death in 1950 .
The trial of Sri Aurobindo Ghosh and other colleagues was one of the Alipore अलीपुर of historical importance as it had happened at a time when discontent in Bengal was at its peak .
It was a trial of enlightened and educated people who came from the elite of the society .
This agitation was aroused by the विदेशियों of the British High हत्याओं and the विदेशियों of the British people in the trial and by the articles of war against the ' विदेशियों ' and ' ब्रिटिश ' . The ' विदेशियों ' Association ' s विदेशियों ' .

The Meerut conspiracy case exposed the true face of British imperialism against organised opposition or dissent which could challenge the political and economic superiority of the established order .
In fact it was a determined effort to crush the organised labour movement and Marxist influence in India as all the major industries and operations were then dominated by the British .
The period 1928 - 1929 was significant in Indian history for it was the beginning of an organised left - wing movement ( including all economic and political components ) .
The organisation of the trade unions enabled the workers to express their grievances and strive for better pay and better working conditions .
Although the Communist Party of India had been active for a long time in India the movement could not gain any real significance till 1927 .
It was only after 1927 that the communists at Calcutta during the 1929 - 29 were able to make considerable headway in their efforts to infiltrate the trade unions and the labour organisation and to win over a powerful section of the nationalist देशभक्त .
Even some British citizens were making active contributions to this movement .
Soon the British Government became alarmed and undertook a series of legislative and administrative steps to nip the movement in the bud .
The most important and oppressive step was the षड्यंत्र of the Congress to launch a mass conspiracy case against the prominent left - wing activists who had considerably affected the future of the Indian Communist Party and the entire left movement of the country .
The Government of India was in continuous correspondence with the British Government in England and was taking instructions to adopt legislative and punitive measures .

The Government of India promulgated an Ordinance on 1st May 1930 1930 .
The ordinance entrusted the trial of the trial to a Special Tribunal like the one which tried the लाहौर during the First World War to be constituted by the Chief Justice of the High Court of Lahore consisting of the High Court judges .
The Tribunal was invested with special powers to deal with wilful obstruction.
It lays down that all cases pending in the court of Rai Sahib Pandit Sri Kishan first - class magistrate Lahore against 24 persons would be tried by the Tribunal to be constituted under Section 4 .
The Chief Justice of the High Court would constitute a Tribunal for the trial of the said cases consisting of three persons who at the time of such constitution were judges additional judges or officiating judges of the High Court .
The Chief Justice of the High Court बनायेंगे a member of the Tribunal shall be made the President and the Tribunal shall give the right to any person convicted by him legal punishment for the offences committed by him .
Even if death sentence was passed it would not require confirmation by the High Court as provided in the " Code of Criminal Procedure " .
If one of the accused committed consciously to appear before the Tribunal or he is constantly पेशी in his or her appearance he or she is likely to undergo violent acts of omission and commission by the accused at such times .
The decision of the Tribunal was final and conclusive and no order or sentence of the court could be appealed against under the provisions of the Nyaya Code or any other judicial statute which existed or anything of any authority.
Not only that the High Court had no right to reconsider any such order or sentence or to transfer the case from the Tribunal to any other area under Section आपराधिक of the Act or to make any other proceeding contrary to the ordinance .
It was an extraordinary procedure and the result was a foregone conclusion .

We all know about rains which shower water .
But have you ever heard of the rain in which acids are showered instead of water ?
Of course this is a new phenomenon occurring since the past three decades in different parts of the world where industries are clustered and where large numbers of automobiles वाहनों .
Rain falls as pure water and on its enroute to the earth reacts with the oxides of sulphur and nitrogen to form acid .
No doubt from the industrial emissions where coal and oil are fired from factories and from automobile exhausts .
Acid rain is thus created by industrial activities that pollute the air .
The main sources are electric power plants that use the energy produced by burning coal to generate electricity .
Most coal contain small amounts of sulphur which is converted to sulphur dioxide when the coal is burned.
Why are environmental scientists so worried about acid rain ?
For it is a world - wide crisis because although it क्षति a large part of the northern hemisphere of the world it now रूख its attention to the industrial areas of the southern Hemisphere and खा associated with the pollution of the modern जंगलों waters .
अम्लता or पानी of water is measured on scale .
As already indicated rain - water has a pH of less than 7 .
Then what is it that makes the ordinary rain - water turn acidic ( वर्षा ) and then the same acid rain on the earth ?
The change comes from industrial gases ( oxides of sulphur ) and from automobile exhausts ( oxides of nitrogen ) .
These gases react under the influence of तनु catalysts and sun ' s rays before dissolving in water droplets and ice crystals to form dilute acid solutions .
These acid solutions fall to the earth as rain snow hail ओस dew and fog .
A peculiarity of acid rain is that while the causative agents are emitted at one place the acid rain falls at another place .
The pollutants released in one country enter the atmosphere and together with the air currents move thousands of kilometres across the earth to fall as acid rain on another .
For example the pollutants released in England and Germany were deposited as acid rain in Sweden and Norway .
While Canada releases much less of pollutant gases in comparison to the United States of America acid rain is still higher in Canada .
Rainfall knows no national boundaries and unlike other types of pollution acid rain is regarded as a global phenomenon .
Since the advent of the industrial revolution in the eighteenth century man has been engaged in discovering varied sources of energy for manufacturing varied types .
Ultimately more coal and fuel have to be burnt and the sulphur contained in the fuel gets converted to sulphur .
The problem of acid rain started in the early fifties of 1950 .
To reduce the amount of smoke released in the atmosphere the use of gas गैस was introduced to reduce the burning of coal in thermal power plants to separate the release of carbon dioxide gas from electrical emissions .
The newer power plants built far away from the cities are provided with high chimneys often more than 150 metres high to disperse the sulphur dioxide so that it would not reach the ground in high concentration .
Most of the sulphur dioxide remains in the air for a long time so that more of it is converted to sulphuric acid .
A recent survey indicates that about 150 million tonnes of sulphur dioxide are discharged into the atmosphere every year which in turn is converted into sulphuric acid .
Two - thirds of the acid rain is because of sulphuric acid .
About a third of the acid rain is due to nitric acid which in turn produces nitric acid by reaction with oxides of nitrogen from automobiles .
It is estimated that each year about 40 million tonnes of oxides of nitrogen are released into the atmosphere .

Most forms of inorganic mercury are converted to methyl mercury by micro - organisms under certain conditions in an aquatic environment .
Fish can absorb methyl mercury from their gills or eat them ; even the small phytoplankton and जंतु which absorb methyl mercury from the water .
These plants and animals are fed to methyl mercury by shells .

Mercury enters and remains in the brain causing damage .

Cadmium ranks next to mercury in its poisoning .
The principal contributor of cadmium is the कैडमियम industry .
It tends to accumulate in the liver kidneys and thyroid and causes high blood pressure cramps nausea vomiting and diarrhoea .
Cadmium tends to be absorbed by suspended particles and settles to the bottom of the water .
For this reason even in polluted rivers the cadmium levels in the water may not be detectable but can have serious consequences .

The temperature of water is considered to be a major feature of the environment as it may affect the concentration of dissolved oxygen the आक्सीजन the rate of biochemical reactions and the physical activity of aquatic animals .
Most species of fish can adapt themselves to a fairly wide range of water temperature provided the temperature gradually changed .
Sharp changes in temperature such as sudden rise or decrease are often harmful .
The temperature changes not only affect fish but also the entire aquatic environment .
If the change in temperature alters types and जीवों of lower organisms then the fish may lack the right food .
The activities of pathogenic organisms are accelerated by higher temperatures and they become more dangerous .
As such if one or two species disappear the ecosystem may not have sufficient diversity left to compensate for the damage .

The rise of the Vijayanagar Empire to check the Muslim conquest campaign in the middle of the 14th century resulted in a new impetus to the temple architecture by creating an inclusive and structural formation of the existing structures .

Mahatma Gandhi ' s case ( 1922 ) Mahatma Gandhi and प्रकाशक Banker publisher of महात्मा इंडिया were convicted of four British लेखों in 1922 under Section 124 - A of the Indian Penal Code .
It was the first trial which involved the legality and morality of the Indian non - co - operation movement .
The Hon 'ble Chief Justice J . M . न्यायालय of the Gujarat High Court noted :
Barring the trial of Socrates there is perhaps no trial in the history of mankind as it did in the case of Gandhiji which stimulated so much interest and had such a deep impact on human life .
The similarity in the attitude adopted by Socrates and Gandhiji towards the Tribunals who tried them is that they both gave a high status to truth than law and received the punishment for breaking the law . "
The trial of Gandhiji is similar to that of Socrates because it concerns itself with the conflict between the issue of allegiance to the State on the one hand and on the other with a sense of morality and duty as the person concerned .

Conclusion The Meerut trial was from the very beginning a political trial .
Thus the trial proceeded towards it and assumed a propagandist character on both sides .
The opening of the campaign was carried out by Mr अभियोक्ता James the chief public prosecutor who vehemently attacked communism national and international in the choicest phraseology आक्रमण the communists as enemies of civilised society .
The spirited defendants in their turn seized the opportunity to make political speeches and propaganda statements from the court .
Most of the accused had decided to make such statements particularly the communists as it would have helped the spread of the ideology and programme of the Communist Party .
To this end each of the accused delivered his personal defence before the joint statement .

The pH is an index of hydrogen ion concentration of a liquid .
हाइड्रोजन low pH means high concentration of hydrogen ion and high acidity .
Pure water has a pH of 7 ( पानी ) which is neutral pH .
Water with less than 7 it becomes acidic and alkaline when above 7 .
Rain - water usually has a pH lower than 7 ( pH 5. 7 ) due to the dissolved carbon dioxide in it; this amount of acidity is not क्षयकारी .
The pH range of acid rain - water is 2 - 5 .
This low pH means high acidity and subsequently high क्षयकारी .
Thus water with pH 4 is more corrosive - LRB - 10 times - RRB - than water with pH 5.
Water of pH 3 is still more corrosive - LRB - 100 times - RRB - than water having a pH 5.
If this is the case then one can imagine the corrosive nature of the acid rain with a pH ranging between. 2 and 3 .

Mahatma Gandhi . - पोरबंदर Mahatma Gandhi was born on 2nd October 1869 at Porbandar in Gujarat .
He was the youngest of three brothers and had a sister .
His father Karamchand पिता was Prime Minister of Rajkot .
Gandhi was in school till 1887.
Gandhi was married in 1881 to था .
After spending nine months in a college he went to England in September 1888 to study law .
He returned to India in 1891 and set himself up as a lawyer.
In April 1893 Gandhi was called to Natal in the service of a merchant named Seth अब्दुल्ला .
On arrival he experienced in person the harsh treatment meted out to coloured people by अश्वेत .
There he read " The Kingdom of God was within you and was also influenced by his writings .
Gandhi returned to India on 19 December 1914 and after a brief and अवररूद्ध stay in February - March 1915 collected his companions of अहमदाबाद 1914 and established the Satyagraha Ashram in Ahmedabad city on 25 May 1915 .
It was shifted in June 1917 to the banks of the Sabarmati river opposite the city .
Between 1917 and 1918 Gandhi participated in two movements in Champaran ( Bihar ) and खैरा ( Gujarat ) and in the labour dispute in Ahmedabad .
World War I ended on 11 November 1918 and this was followed by the proposal of the Rowlatt Bills designed to curb the rising tide of rebellion in India .
Gandhi reacted strongly against the oppressive measures and stood for the resurgent Indian nationalism .
From 1924 to 1929 Gandhi devoted himself entirely to constructive programmes and launched many " Satyagraha " movement .
In 1924 he was elected president of the Indian National Congress .
There have been a number of detailed studies on his philosophy of life and on political राजनैतिक social religious and economic ideas .
Gandhi has been looked upon by many primarily as a religious leader many accepted him as the leader of Indian nationalism .
He was very regular and methodical in his habits and austere in his style of living .
Gandhi respected the deep religious beliefs of every individual and his treatment for men and women was entirely humane and he would do everything to alleviate the sufferings of all those who came to him for shelter .

The pH is an index of hydrogen ion concentration of a liquid .
Water with less than 7 it becomes acidic and alkaline when above 7 .
The pH range of acid rain - water is 2 - 5 .
Thus water with pH 4 is more corrosive - LRB - 10 times - RRB - than water with pH 5.

Another important architectural feature is the torana लक्षण which is essentially an arched festoon ( sometimes straight as in the toranas of Sanchi ) and marking a sacred or ceremonial gate .
Such free - standing torana entrances or स्तंभ toranas are stated to have preceded the gopura entrances of ancient prasada .
But while the स्मारकों torana has been retained in the northern monuments as at Sanchi and Bhubaneswar it is the gopura entrance that has prevailed in the south and forms the most characteristic and invariable part of the temple complex .
The torana idea is however not concluded ; the motif is applied to many niches and entrances on the body of the vimana or the gopura and are known as भित्ति toranas .
These are found to frame the entrances of some cave - temples the fronts of the niches or devakoshthas on the walls of the vimana and the fronts of the nasikas of various orders and विमान . the sukanasika the विमान - nasika and the अल्पनासिका .

The first question of the trial arises as to whether under the International Law a king could be tried as a common man : there is no doubt that Bahadur Shah was a King and he was accepted as King .
The Britishers prior to 1857 were no sovereign rulers of India and Bahadur Shah was not their subject though he was awarded a pension.
During the freedom struggle in 1857 a stage came when the Delhi Company became de jure and de facto independent of the rule and Bahadur Shah was declared as King ' s Emperor .
In such circumstances it may be said that trying Bahadur Shah as a विद्रोही was not proper according to law and was not fair or justice .
Though according to law of evidence the prosecutor placed before the court enough material to prove the charge it remained legally नहीं as Bahadur Shah was in no position to cross - examine or defend himself nor was he provided any legal aid .
The conditions in the country were such at that time that nobody having any legal knowledge had the courage to come forward to defend Bahadur Shah .
The verdict cannot be treated as a legal decision after hearing both the parties .
The manner in which Bahadur Shah was brought to Delhi after the defeat and the manner in which the evidence was produced is proved that the trial was a farce .
Indeed Bahadur Shah as a ruler should not have been tried at such a trial .
Not only that he was not in a mental state to face such a trial and defend himself .
He was 82 - years - old .
His wife Zeenat Mahal including all his fellow - men had almost deserted him .
The trial attracted more than two months .
At no time was there any doubt about the verdict.
On 29 March 1858 Bahadur Shah was found guilty of all the charges and subsequently sentenced to transportation for life .
He left Delhi in October 1858 accompanied by बेगम Bakht बख्त Shah थीं Shah बेगम and his wife Zeenat Mahal who had by now become full - grown tired and fed him " miserable बूढा ' .

What is Unicode ?
Unicode provides a unique number for each character है
no matter what the ,
no matter what the program is.
be it any language .
Computer कम्प्यूटर deals with originally हैं numbers .
They store letters and characters by assigning a number for each letter and letter .
Before Unicode was invented there were hundreds of different encoding systems for assigning these numbers .
In a single encoding there may be enough letters : for example the European Union alone needs several different encodings to cover all its languages .
For a language like English the alphabet was not sufficient for all the letters punctuation and technical symbols used in common use .
These encoding systems also conflict with one another .
That is why the two encodings can use the same number for two different characters - either for the same number or use different numbers for the same letter .
Any computer ( especially the server ) needs to support various encodings ( e ) but still has the risk of always deterioration of the data between two different encodings or nodes ) .
Unicode is changing all this thing .
Unicode (UTF - 32 provides a unique number for each letter ; no matter what the program चाहे no matter what the language it is .
The Unicode Standard has been adopted by leading companies of industry like ' ऐपल ' कम्पनियों ' कम्पनियों ' s सन सन and M . P . M . S . सन . . सन Sun सन कम्पनियों कम्पनियों and many others .
Unicode is required by the use of modern standards ( like x M ) L . W . जावा Script ( Java script ) जावा L . C . पी standards ( , ) and is applicable for अधिकारिक .
It occurs in many operating systems . all modern browsers and many other products .
The emergence of the Unicode Standard and the availability of its supporting equipment are among the most significant recent global software technology trends .
The inclusion of Unicode into client - server or multi - dimensional devices and websites offers significant savings in the spending of traditional equipment rather than using .
Unicode enables a single software product or a single website उत्पाद which can be used in various languages and countries without a Delhi - based engineering .
It allows data to be transported through different systems without any restriction .
Unicode (UTF - 32 is a non - profit organization founded by the Unicode Standard . for presentation of text in modern software products and standards . development of लाभ and encouraging its use .
The membership of this organisation includes various corporations and organisations in the computer and information industry .
Membership in the Unicode Consortium is open to organizations and individuals anywhere in the world who support Unicode and wish to assist in its extension and implementation .
For more information see the Unicode Glossary Unicode Enabled Products , Technical Introduction and Useful source .
